response.answer_text: An unknown Semite guy in Masada. I think it is the first documented use of an elevator used to handle people and bring them into the inexpungable fortress of Masada for which there was no valley entry and could only be assailed by building a surrounding climbing platform. But if you mean modern building elevators the name is Otis, and some references that early elevators were built in castles and fortresses by particular engineers associated to Nobility in previous centuries. Some research might bring out some names though all commercial elevators nowadays are Otis first design enhancements.

Elisha Otis, he wanted an efficient yet safe way to transport freight up a factory building. He invented an elevator which was to be a safe way to transport freight up. He later started the Otis Elevator company which was the first ever elevator manufacturer since it was started by the inventor.
